description.narrative: The project focuses on promoting and implementing responsible business conduct and the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights in the Sub-Saharan African region, with a specific focus on national implementation in Ethiopia and Tanzania, and on the human rights implications of the energy and digital transitions.

title.narrative: Output 1.1. Ethiopia: Relevant state, business and civil society actors have strengthened capacity on and collaboration for implementation of the UNGPs.

Documentation from a scoping study and multi-stakeholder dialogues demonstrates collaborative identification of salient business and human rights issues for the country and concrete recommendations for UNGPs implementation, including with focus on the energy and digital transitions.

target.value: - A scoping study has been undertaken that has included identification of key stakeholders and salient business and human rights issues for the country - The scoping study includes an overview of the status of policy and practice elements of the energy and digital transitions - Select relevant state. business and civil society actors have been engaged to foster their capacity on business and human rights (DCA will focus on civil society engagement through their complementary project).

actual.value: - Project output delayed by 12 months due to COVID19, the scoping study will be undertaken in 2021 and the multi-stakeholder engagement and national dialogue continued in 2022. - DIHR continued its engagement with Ethiopian stakeholders to identify partners for localising the business and human rights agenda, with Center for the Advancement of Rights and Democracy (CARD) selected for financial support in summer 2021.

title.narrative: Outcome 1: National-level implementation of the UNGPs in Ethiopia and Tanzania

Key state actors in Ethiopia and Tanzania have embarked on a process to develop policy initiatives, such as national action plans, to implement the UNGPs.
Documentation of institutionalised steps, including uptake of tools and analysis, towards policy initiatives to implement the UNGPs.

target.value: In Tanzania and Ethiopia. multi-stakeholder dialogue is established on business and human rights to foster UNGPs implementation in policy and practice.

title.narrative: Outcome 2: Regional and global outreach on the energy and technology transitions
Region specific analyses on the human rights implications of the energy and digital transitions have been produced and disseminated.

target.value: Sector-specific input is generated for the UNGPs national implementation processes in Ethiopia. Tanzania and other countries. Knowledge and good practices for state actors and other key stakeholders is generated to promote better understanding of the respective roles and responsibilities of state actors and businesses in the energy and digital transitions.
